abstract: South African lawmakers have released draft law that would refer cases involving hate speech to criminal instead of civil courts, effectively criminalizing racism; law was drawn up in response to widely viewed video of white South African motorist Vicki Momberg using word kaffir, most offensive racial slur in country, to describe black people; proposed law has sparked fierce debate.

headline.print_headline: Racist Tirade and a Call to Action in South Africa
headline.main: Jail Time for Using South Africa’s Worst Racial Slur?

snippet: A South African woman is on trial after a racist tirade was caught on video, and lawmakers are moving to make hate speech a crime punishable by imprisonment....
lead_paragraph: A South African woman is on trial after a racist tirade was caught on video, and lawmakers are moving to make hate speech a crime punishable by imprisonment.
